author: jerenkrantz
msg: Two minor bug fixes for pipelined responses.
* buckets/buckets.c
(serf_util_readline): If we don't find a newline in our buffer, we need to
advance the buffer so that we can fetch more (otherwise, we'll loop forever).
Our callers must deal with the _NONE response anyway, so let's give them the
partial line.
* buckets/response_buckets.c:
(serf_response_read): If we are waiting for the body and we see EAGAIN before
we get there, update the length to reflect that the rest of the loop will
not run (otherwise, we'll have an unset *len value).

author: jerenkrantz
msg: * context.c (open_connections): Use the context directly.

author: jerenkrantz
msg: Fix buglet introduced in r855.
* context.c
(read_from_connection): return APR_SUCCESS in the case where we're exhausted.

author: jerenkrantz
msg: Revert r854 and replace with a better strategy by marking a pollset as dirty
when needed and only updating the pollset when we next run the context.
* context.c
(serf_context_t): Add flag to indicate we have a dirty pollset.
(serf_connection_t): Indicate our connection needs its pollset entry updated
(open_connections): Flag our pollset and new connection as dirty
(write_to_connection, read_from_connection): When we're exhausted, change
our pollset flag.
(check_dirty_pollsets): Walk our connection list if we have a dirty pollset.
(serf_context_run): Call check_dirty_pollsets after openning connections.
(serf_request_deliver): Always update the pollset flag (the root cause of
the problem identified in r854).

author: jerenkrantz
msg: Fix a pipelining bug that occurs if we push in a request while we are
processing another request that is not completed.
* context.c
(read_from_connection): If we switched to a new request, update the
pollset unconditionally.  Otherwise, the pollset might not know that
we have data to write this time around.
